message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

The paper deals with the problem of finding local correspondences between images with different viewpoints, which is a common problem in computer vision. The proposed method involves using group convolutions to exploit underlying structures of the extracted features on the group, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper proposes a novel visual descriptor that is both discriminative and robust to geometric transformations, which involves learning transformation invariance. This suggests that the paper could also belong to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper presents experimental results on several benchmark datasets, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category cs.MM (Multimedia).
